titleStmt.title: Order for payment [ca. 255-251 BC]
titleStmt.author: Zenon, son of Agreophon, of Caunus, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 332-333

msContents.summary: Order for payment written in epistolary form from Zenon to Artemidoros, concerning the pay of Diodoros

msItem.note: Written along the fibers with 5 lines; the back is blank
It was folded 5 times and the marks are very evident
Written in a fast cursive hand, similar to the hands of many dockets in the archive

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 32 (original no. 103) in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Artemidoros, -- banker, 8 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 302
Diodoros, -- scribe, 3 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 316

div.ab: Zenon to Artemidoros, greeting. Pay to Diodoros, scribe, as wages for Phamenoth, 15 drachmas copper. Good-bye. Year 3-, Phamenoth 20.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. III 45 P.Col.Zen. I 45 Bagnall and Bogaert in "Ancient Society" 6 (1975) 94
